intro: Philippia procaviana, commonly known as the yellow bellflower, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its showy, yellow bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. It has opposite, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, capsule-like fruits. Philippia procaviana is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens.
